profiles:
Summary • Seeking a challenging role where an exceptional background in Project and Program Management, Information Technology, and Business will create opportunities for growth and profitability. 
• Dedicated leader with more than 10 years of providing direction, improvement, and innovation to numerous programs and projects with the Information Technology group at Residential & Dining Enterprises, Stanford University. 
• Mastery of the Full Lifecycle of Project Management Methodology, and every stage of the Systems Development lifecycle. 
• Recognized for using a wide range of influence, motivational, and communication skills to cultivate powerful professional relationships, and expanding those relationships for the benefit of the entire company. 
• Certified Scrum Master 
 
Specialities: Vendor Communications, Change Management, Resource Allocation, Facilities/IWMS Management, Requirements Management, Schedule Management, Process Analysis, Risk Management, Marketing and Branding, Social Events Coordination, Emotional Intelligence Summary • Seeking a challenging role where an exceptional background in Project and Program Management, Information Technology, and Business will create opportunities for growth and profitability.

Specialities: Vendor Communications, Change Management, Resource Allocation, Facilities/IWMS Management, Requirements Management, Schedule Management, Process Analysis, Risk Management, Marketing and Branding, Social Events Coordination, Emotional Intelligence Experience Project Manager (Contractor) Stanford University May 2015  – Present (4 months) Project Manager eCIFM Solutions Inc. April 2014  –  May 2015  (1 year 2 months) San Ramon Co-VP of Fundraising (Part-time Volunteer) Parent Faculty Group, Christa McAuliffe Elementary School June 2013  –  May 2015  (2 years) Responsible for bringing in $416k donations to support programs and operations for the school as part of the Parent Faculty Group Board. Program Manager, Project Manager, Business Analyst Stanford University May 2001  –  June 2013  (12 years 2 months) Information Technology group in Residential & Dining Enterprises Provide business analysis, program and project management services for all system development requests and projects. Manage multiple projects, lead requirements gathering and review sessions to develop functional requirements and RFPs, provide analysis and recommendations to resolve issues, and provide ongoing support for various applications. 
 
Program and project managed various project implementations including:  
- Tririga IWMS facilities management system 
- Eatec purchasing and inventory management system 
- Micros hotel reservation system 
- Computrition menu management system 
 
Other duties included: 
- Served as Interim Manager for IT Projects group managing 3 Project Managers and implemented a project directory structure, established templates and gate approvals to support the project management methodology 
- Kicked off and directed a newly formed R&DE Web Services group to develop a vision, objectives and strategic goals focused on delivering engaging user experiences to expand R&DE’s digital brand 
- Provided oversight for the implementation of the Places tile in the iStanford iPhone application working with other University groups to showcase R&DE venues 
- Led and completed website redesign and rollout of the R&DE Homepage in line with new R&DE rebranding to drive traffic and promote exposure to digital community 
- Led the implementation of the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Infrastructure. This initiative was the foundation for later projects on the EDW to drive business results through analysis 
- Member of the R&DE Information Technology management team reporting into the CIO 
- Acted in the role of IT Partner at the R&DE Technology Advisory Committee (IT Steering Committee) working in collaboration with the business units and IT 
- Member of the University’s iStanford Mobile Steering Committee representing R&DE  
- Served as representative on Tririga Customer Advisory Board from 2004 to 2013, attending the IBM Tririga User Conference every year Consultant DiaLogos (CRM Consulting) 1999  –  2000  (1 year) •	Implemented CRM capabilities at Fortune 500 technology company 
•	Redesigned registration process for improved navigation and user experience at an e-commerce service company  
•	Worked on project through complete development lifecycle - analyze, design, code, debug, QA requirements in Broadvision - for clicks and mortar retailer to implement content management system 
•	Identified customer data acquisition and retention strategies to support database marketing initiatives at a Fortune 500 toy company 
•	Analyzed process requirements for a Contact Management system and recommended solution providers for a hospital cooperative Consultant Accenture (Andersen Consulting) 1996  –  1999  (3 years) •	Led project team through complete development lifecycle for a new version release on a trade finance system 
•	Developed and rolled out a trade finance system in three countries by working with multiple client teams 
•	Provided post-production system, support, and training to end-users. Created functional and system training materials for completed trade finance system  
•	Developed procedures to improve clients’ help desk processes. Investigated and serviced system bugs and enhancements during trade finance system rollout 
•	Developed user requirements through client interviews and focus groups  
•	Analyzed and translated user requirements into business and technical requirements Process Analyst (Intern) Rockwell Automation (NZ) Ltd 1994  –  1994  (less than a year) •	Identified, documented and analyzed process flows through interviews and focus groups for the purpose of ISO certification 
•	Performed gap analysis to identify ISO requirements Project Manager (Contractor) Stanford University May 2015  – Present (4 months) Project Manager (Contractor) Stanford University May 2015  – Present (4 months) Project Manager eCIFM Solutions Inc. Summary Tim Boswell began his career on a sniper team in the 101st Airborne Division (Air Assault), and then moved into reconnaissance and counter-reconnaissance, eventually evolving into communications and information security. 
 
As a signal communications officer, Tim held various positions in the Pacific theater, which included information assurance security officer and encryption management. He provided support to the U.S. Embassy and State Department in Korea, and managed the primary communications node in Asia linking tactical commands with strategic commands. 
 
Tim transitioned out of the military and joined Williams Communication Solutions as a project manager and later managed the services partnership with Cisco Systems. Through aggressive project management, his program was the only Cisco partner to maintain 100% service delivery levels for five straight quarters. 
 
In 2004, Tim was recalled back to active military service under Operation Enduring Freedom and served as an Information Security Manager and DoD Level III Information Assurance Manager. He led a project team on the initial rollout of the Common Access Card, the DoD’s smart card system that implemented email encryption and digital signatures via public key infrastructure and removed all passwords from the entire network. Tim also directed a cyber incident response team (CIRT) charged with responding to events in the field on a moment’s notice, based on escalations from various cyber incident response centers (CIRC). 
 
After attaining the rank of Major, Tim was released back to the private sector in 2007 and recruited by RSA, the Security Division of EMC. While at RSA, he worked with half of the companies in the Fortune 500 to help them implement or improve their CIRCs and Security Operations Centers (SOC), as well as provide assistance on their security operations, programs and projects.
